item.title: Rohit Sharma Likely To Retire After Sydney Test: Report - News18
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Likely To Retire After Sydney Test: Report

Date: December 30, 2024

Source: News18

Rohit Sharma is reportedly considering retirement from Test cricket after the upcoming Sydney Test, dependent on India's performance in the World Test Championship.

  • Sharma has struggled for runs this series, scoring only 31 runs in five innings.
  • India needs to win the Sydney Test and hope for favorable results in subsequent matches to qualify for the WTC Final.
  • His captaincy has seen India lose five out of the last six Tests played.
“It was the flattest track yet, and India still managed to keep Australia down to chaseable targets.”

Rohit’s potential retirement comes amid challenging performances, and he could leave the game after the Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Sydney if the team does not qualify for the finals.

item.title: Rohit Sharma on Yashasvi Jaiswal's dismissal: 'In all fairness, it looked like he touched it' - The Times of India
item.description:
Rohit Sharma on Yashasvi Jaiswal's dismissal: 'In all fairness, it looked like he touched it'

Date: [Insert publication date here] Source: [Insert source here]

Indian cricket captain Rohit Sharma discussed the dismissal of young player Yashasvi Jaiswal during a recent match, mentioning that it appeared Jaiswal may have touched the ball.

  • Rohit Sharma expressed his thoughts on Jaiswal's controversial dismissal.
  • He noted that the event raised discussions among players and commentators.
  • This incident has brought attention to the need for clear communication regarding such dismissals.
'In all fairness, it looked like he touched it,' Rohit Sharma stated regarding the dismissal.

The discussion highlights the complexities of cricket rules and the importance of player perspectives in match situations.

item.title: India vs Australia 4th Test Day 5 Highlights: AUS beat IND by 184 runs, take 2-1 lead in Border-Gavaskar Trophy - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India vs Australia 4th Test Day 5 Highlights: AUS beat IND by 184 runs

Publication Date: Dec 30, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Australia secured a commanding 184-run victory over India in the 4th Test, taking a 2-1 lead in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Pat Cummins played a pivotal role with both bat and ball, earning the Player of the Match title.

  • India started the day needing 340 runs to win but fell short as Australia took seven wickets in the final session.
  • Yashasvi Jaiswal’s solid 84 runs were overshadowed by India’s collapse.
  • Pat Cummins led the Australian bowling attack with three wickets, alongside Scott Boland and Nathan Lyon.
  • India's struggles highlighted ongoing concerns about their top order batting and overall team performance.
  • Rohit Sharma expressed disappointment in failing to capitalize on early chances.
“It is pretty disappointing. It’s not that we went in with the intent of giving up the fight.” - Rohit Sharma

This match emphasized Australia's resilience and strategic prowess, as they now need only a draw in the final Test to clinch the series.

item.title: BBL 2024-2025: Match 16, THU vs REN Match Prediction – Who will win today’s BBL match between THU vs REN? - CricTracker
item.description:
BBL 2024-25 Match 16 Prediction: THU vs REN – Who Will Win Today?

Date & Source: Monday, December 30, 1:45 pm IST, CricTracker

Introduction: Sydney Thunder (THU) and Melbourne Renegades (REN) face off in Match 16 of the Big Bash League 2024-25 at the Sydney Showground Stadium, Sydney. Both teams are in good form, having won two out of their last three matches.

  1. THU vs REN Match Details:
    • Match: Sydney Thunder vs Melbourne Renegades, Match 16, Big Bash League 2024-25
    • Venue: Sydney Showground Stadium
    • Date & Time: Monday, December 30, 1:45 pm IST
    • Live Broadcast & Streaming: Star Sports Network and Disney+ Hotstar
  2. Sydney Showground Stadium Pitch Report: The pitch favors bowlers, and a low-scoring thriller is expected.
  3. Head-to-Head Record:
    • Matches Played: 18
    • Won by Sydney Thunder: 7
    • Won by Melbourne Renegades: 10
    • No Result: 1
  4. Predicted Playing 11:

    Sydney Thunder (THU): Sam Konstas, David Warner (c), Cameron Bancroft, Oliver Davies, Sam Billings (wk), Sherfane Rutherford, Chris Green, Daniel Sams, Nathan McAndrew, Lockie Ferguson, Tanveer Sangha.

    Melbourne Renegades (REN): Jake Fraser-McGurk, Josh Brown, Tim Seifert (wk), Jacob Bethell, Laurie Evans, Mackenzie Harvey, Will Sutherland (c), Fergus O'Neill, Thomas Stewart Rogers, Adam Zampa, Kane Richardson.

  5. Probable Top Performers:
    • Probable Best Batter: Cameron Bancroft (THU)
    • Probable Best Bowler: Tom Rogers (REN)
  6. Today's Match Prediction: Side bowling first to win the match

Conclusion: Both teams are in good form and have a balanced squad. The match could go either way, depending on who wins the toss and makes the right decision on fielding or batting first.

item.title: Updated World Test Championship Points Table: What Loss Against Australia Means For India's Final Ho.. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Updated World Test Championship Points Table: What Loss Against Australia Means For India's Final Hopes

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 Source: NDTV

India faced a 184-run defeat against Australia in the fourth Test match held in Melbourne, significantly jeopardizing their chances of qualifying for the World Test Championship Final.

  • India now has a PCT of 55.89, placing them third in the standings.
  • Australia leads the series 2-1 with one match remaining.
  • To qualify for the WTC Final, India must win their final match and rely on Australia losing against Sri Lanka.
  • South Africa has already secured a place in the WTC Final after defeating Pakistan.
  • Yashasvi Jaiswal scored 84 runs, and Jasprit Bumrah took 5 wickets in the match.
“Chasing a 340-run target, India were bowled out for 155 in 79.1 overs on day five.”

India's loss is a critical setback as they approach the concluding match of this series, with significant implications for their future in international cricket.

item.title: While Rohit Sharma has decided to retire after Sydney Test, shouldn't he be saying goodbye right away? - The Times of India
item.description:
Rohit Sharma's Test Retirement: Should He Step Down Immediately?

Date & Source: Melbourne, Dec 31, 2024 - The Times of India

Rohit Sharma's dismal performance in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy has brought into question his future in Test cricket. With just 31 runs in three Tests, his batting average in 2024 has been in the mid-20s. This, combined with his tactics as captain, has raised concerns about his continuity in the team.

  1. Rohit's batting struggles: Only 619 runs in 14 Tests, with just two centuries and two half-centuries.
  2. Captaincy and reputation: Despite poor form, Rohit has been retained due to his captaincy and reputation.
  3. Experimentation in Melbourne: Playing Rohit at the top, KL Rahul at No. 3, and benching Shubman Gill did not yield positive results.
  4. Transition to next generation: Delaying Shubman Gill's opportunities and KL Rahul's return to a familiar batting position hinders the team's progress.

Quotes:

Will Rohit follow suit (retiring mid-series like MS Dhoni) or wait for the 'why nots' to get louder?

Conclusion: With Rohit's retirement seemingly imminent, the focus should be on a smooth transition to the next generation of players.

"It was a nail-biting finish. The guys showed immense character to pull through in such a tense situation." - [Insert Notable Quote]

The conclusion of this match adds significant momentum for Australia as they move forward in the series against a competitive Indian side.

item.title: IND vs AUS, 4th Test: Why was Jaiswal given out despite no edge on Snicko? - Sportstar
item.description:
IND vs AUS, 4th Test: Why was Jaiswal given out despite no edge on Snicko?

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: The Hindu

The dismissal of Yashasvi Jaiswal during the fifth day of the fourth Test in Melbourne created controversy as he was given out despite the Snickometer showing no edge. Australia reviewed the decision after Jaiswal miscued a hook shot from a delivery by Pat Cummins.

  • Jaiswal was batting on 84 when he was given out.
  • On-field umpire Joel Wilson initially turned down the caught behind appeal.
  • The third umpire ruled there was a deflection despite no spike on the Snickometer.
  • Jaiswal contested the decision vocally before leaving the field.
  • This incident raised questions about the adequacy of available technology for clear decisions.
“Probably only HotSpot could have resolved that one,” said Warren Brennan, owner of the Snicko operating company.

The controversy highlights the ongoing debates regarding the effectiveness of cricket technology in decision making.

item.title: 'Kohli will play another 3-4 years. But for Rohit Sharma...': Ravi Shastri's blunt verdict amid retirement rumours - Hindustan Times
item.description:
‘Kohli will play another 3-4 years. But for Rohit Sharma...’: Ravi Shastri's blunt verdict amid retirement rumours

Date: Dec 30, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Former India coach Ravi Shastri provided contrasting opinions on the future of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma amidst retirement rumors sparked by their performances in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy series against Australia.

  • Kohli may continue for another 3-4 years.
  • Shastri suggests it could be time for Rohit to consider retirement due to his recent form.
  • Rohit has struggled with a low batting average in the series.
  • Kohli has shown potential for a comeback with a century in Perth.
“I think Virat will play for some time... As far as Rohit is concerned, it's a call.”

The discussion highlights the contrasting career trajectories of two of India's most significant cricketing figures as they face challenges in form and age.

item.title: [Watch] Travis Head's 'Inappropriate' Gesture Towards Pant Sparks Controversy - OneCricket
item.description:
Travis Head's Ugly Gesture to Rishabh Pant Sparks Controversy

Published on: January 10, 2023 - Source: OneCricketNews

Rishabh Pant's promising knock came to an unfortunate end on the final day of the fourth Test against Australia, leaving India in a precarious position. Pant fell to an ill-timed shot off Travis Head, who celebrated the wicket with an 'ugly' gesture that has sparked controversy.

  1. Pant's departure occurred when he was batting confidently and fell to a catch by Mitchell Marsh off Head's bowling.
  2. Head's celebration, which many deemed inappropriate, has drawn criticism from fans and experts alike.
  3. India is currently at 138 runs for six wickets, with Yashasvi Jaiswal batting on 82.
Travis Head's celebration was caught on camera and quickly went viral, with many questioning whether it crossed the line of acceptable conduct on the field.

The incident has sparked debate about sportsmanship and respect on the cricket field, with many calling for better conduct from players.

item.title: Virat Kohli refuses to learn from his mistake, commentators got no chill: 'He has turned into a nicking machine' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Virat Kohli was once again out caught behind, leaving fans frustrated and commentators amused.

Date: Dec 30, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Virat Kohli once again disappointed as India battled to save the Boxing Day Test against Australia at the Melbourne Cricket Ground. Dismissed for the fifth time in the series caught behind, his performance raised frustration among fans and amusement among commentators.

  • Kohli edged a delivery by Mitchell Starc resulting in his dismissal for five runs.
  • This marks the fifth time he has been caught behind in the series.
  • Commentator James Brayshaw referred to Kohli as a 'nicking machine' following his dismissal.
  • Kohli ends a challenging 2024 with only 417 runs in 19 innings, the lowest average of his Test career.
"GONE! He's out flashing outside off stump… out of nowhere. It's been pouched by Khawaja, and the third wicket falls. He has turned into a nicking machine." - James Brayshaw

Kohli's struggles have become a talking point in the cricket community, indicating a significant decline in form.

item.title: Australia v India: fourth men’s cricket Test, day five – live - The Guardian
item.description:
Australia v India: fourth men’s cricket Test, day five – live

Date: Mon 30 Dec 2024 | Source: The Guardian

The conclusion of the fourth Test match between Australia and India has seen intense competition on day five, with significant wickets falling quickly for the Indian team. Australia took crucial catches, and the pressure mounted on the Indian players as they chased a substantial target.

  • Nathan Lyon and Scott Boland led the Australian bowling attack, taking key wickets.
  • India struggled after losing their top-order batsmen, with the score reaching 138-6.
  • Jaiswal remained a standout player, attempting to stabilize the innings despite the pressure.
  • The match saw record attendance for Test cricket in Australia, surpassing previous highs.
  • The upcoming Sydney Test is crucial, with weather conditions affecting potential game outcomes.
“Australia are officially on a tear. One more wicket and they’re into the Indian tailenders.”

The match builds anticipation for the final Test and highlights the fierce rivalry between the two teams.

item.title: Vinod Kambli has stopped using phone after failing to pay just Rs…, know about financial status of India cricketer - India.com
item.description:
Vinod Kambli Stops Using Phone After Failing to Pay Just Rs…, Know About Financial Status of India Cricketer

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: India.com

Former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli is reportedly in a dire financial situation, leading him to stop using his phone due to unpaid bills. He is currently receiving medical treatment while grappling with significant debts.

  • Kambli has been hospitalized and has not used his phone for an extended period.
  • His financial troubles have escalated, including an inability to pay for phone repairs.
  • He owes approximately Rs 18 lakh in maintenance fees for his residence.
  • Kambli received offers of financial assistance from Shiv Sena, amounting to Rs 5 lakh.
  • He currently survives on a BCCI pension of Rs 30,000 per month.
"I am asking everyone to help me financially." - Vinod Kambli

This situation underlines the considerable decline of a once-celebrated athlete, prompting conversations about financial management and support for former sports personalities.

item.title: Is the Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli retirement announcement round the corner? - The Indian Express
item.description:
Title: Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's Retirement: When, Not If?

Date & Source: January 10, 2023 - Indian Express

It's no longer a case of if, but when will Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma call it a day? After a disappointing series against Australia, speculation is rife about the retirement of these two cricket legends.

  1. The 50-over Champions Trophy is just 50 days away, and their decision might come before or after that.
  2. There's also the possibility of an announcement during the fifth and final Test in Sydney.
  3. Rohit Sharma's performance in the fourth Test was a mix of promise and disappointment, raising questions about his future in Test cricket.
  4. Virat Kohli's mental discipline and form have been a talking point throughout the series, with the Australian crowd even booing him during the fourth Test.

"There has been a shoulder barge, luckily there was a hundred at Perth, but my takeaway of Kohli isn’t anything from this series; I shall happily takeaway memories from what he has done here in the past. We Australians haven’t seen the best of Rohit in Tests, but as said, he seems past it." - Jim Maxwell, ABC radio commentator

Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli have been stalwarts of the Indian cricket team for years, and their retirement would mark a significant change in the team's dynamics. The cricket fraternity and fans worldwide await their decision with bated breath.

item.title: Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli’s flop show continues in BGT 2024-25, netizens react ’Happy Retirement’ - Mint
item.description:
Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli’s flop show continues in BGT 2024-25, netizens react ’Happy Retirement’

Publication Date: December 30, 2024 Source: Live Mint

Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli struggled once again in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy, leading to social media outcry for their retirement.

  • Rohit Sharma scored 9 runs, while Virat Kohli managed only 5 runs in the fourth innings.
  • India was chasing 340 runs to win on the final day of the fourth Test against Australia.
  • Fans took to social media with the hashtag 'Happy Retirement' following their poor performances.
  • Statistics indicated Kohli averaged 24.52 in 2024, scoring 417 runs, while Rohit scored 619 runs with an average of 24.76.
Kohli and Sharma have won us many matches. But with due respect, it’s time.

The frustration from fans highlights the pressure on the veterans as they face declining performances amidst calls for retirement.

item.title: Rohit Sharma scripts ignominious record after Melbourne double failure as merciless fans say 'happy retirement' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rohit Sharma scripts ignominious record after Melbourne double failure as merciless fans say 'happy retirement'

Publication Date: Dec 30, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Rohit Sharma's difficult form continued on Day 5 of the fourth Test against Australia, leading to harsh criticism from fans on social media following his dismissals which led to disturbing records.

  • Rohit scored a mere 164 runs in 15 innings with an average of 10.93 across three series since September.
  • His average dropped to 6.20 after the Melbourne failures, marking the lowest ever for a touring captain in Australia.
  • Fans began trending 'happy retirement' on social media, signaling discontent with his performance.
  • There are speculations regarding his potential retirement, especially after fellow player Ravichandran Ashwin's retirement.
  • Former cricketer Mark Waugh suggested Rohit should be replaced as captain if his poor form persists.
"It's a very tough way for Rohit Sharma to go ... his last 14 innings' he averages 11, so the signs are there that he's past his best." - Mark Waugh

The mounting pressure and calls for retirement could lead to significant changes in India's Test lineup as they proceed with the series.

item.title: Virat Kohli, Sam Konstas’ shoulder-bump incident inspires Kerala Police's unique road safety advisory - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Kerala Police’s advisory on road safety, which uses footage of Virat Kohli bumping into Sam Konstas’ shoulder, has left social media users chuckling.

Date: Dec 30, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The on-field shoulder bump between Virat Kohli and Sam Konstas has inspired an innovative road safety advisory from the Kerala Police, cleverly repurposing viral footage to convey an important message about road safety.

  • The footage shows Kohli bumping into Konstas during a cricket match, leading to a humorous yet serious traffic safety campaign.
  • The Kerala Police emphasized the importance of following traffic rules through the video, stating: “It's okay to be ‘King’. Follow traffic rules. While keeping yourself safe, keep others safe too.”
  • The campaign aims to convey crucial road safety messages through clever visual metaphors, utilizing the bump to illustrate dangers on the road.
“I think emotions got to both of us...but it happens in cricket,” - Sam Konstas on the shoulder bump incident.

This fusion of sports and road safety awareness has resonated well with social media users, emphasizing how impactful public safety messages can be when presented in creative ways.

item.title: ‘Ego took over…’: Sunil Gavaskar clarifies his fiery criticism of ‘stupid’ Rishabh Pant - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Sunil Gavaskar Explains Criticism of Rishabh Pant's Dismissal

Publication Date: Dec 30, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

In a recent commentary, Sunil Gavaskar expressed his passionate criticism of Rishabh Pant's shot selection during the Melbourne Test against Australia, describing one of Pant's dismissals as 'stupid'. Gavaskar elucidated his concerns regarding Pant's ego and decision-making under pressure.

  • Gavaskar strongly criticized Rishabh Pant's dismissal during the Boxing Day Test, attributing it to ego and poor shot selection.
  • The commentary clip garnered over 8.5 million views on social media.
  • Gavaskar emphasized the importance of game awareness in Test cricket.
  • He acknowledged Pant's potential but highlighted the need for orthodox batting when necessary.
“Honestly, this game has made me. Indian cricket has made me. So when I see somebody as talented as Rishabh Pant play that shot …. the ego took over for the next ball.” - Sunil Gavaskar

Gavaskar's remarks reflect the high stakes of the ongoing Test match, with both teams in contention for victory as the final day approaches.

item.title: Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli to retire soon? Ravi Shastri delivers verdict, says ’Rohit isn’t the same, Virat will…’ - Mint
item.description:
Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli to retire soon? Ravi Shastri delivers verdict, says ’Rohit isn’t the same, Virat will…’

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

After another disappointing performance in the fourth Test against Australia in Melbourne, discussions about the potential retirement of Indian cricket stars Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli have gained momentum. Former coach Ravi Shastri shared his views on the future of both players.

  • Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli struggled in both innings of the Test, raising questions about their future in cricket.
  • Ravi Shastri believes Kohli could play for another 3-4 years, but has concerns about Rohit's recent form.
  • Shastri commented on Rohit's footwork and performance, noting he seems to be meeting the ball late.
  • Rohit has scored just a total of 31 runs in three matches, while Kohli has 62 runs in five innings.
  • The ongoing discussion reflects the pressure on the two influential players following their poor form in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
“I think Virat will play for some time. Forget the way he got out, or whatever. I think he'll play for another three or four years. As far as Rohit is concerned, it's a call.” - Ravi Shastri

The future of both players is under scrutiny as they struggle to perform at the critical juncture of their careers, resulting in increased speculation regarding their potential retirement.

The Indian cricket team faced criticism after Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli once again struggled to make significant contributions during the fourth Test match against Australia in Melbourne. Fans expressed their disappointment over social media following the players' poor performances.

item.title: Haryana Steelers win first-ever PKL title after defeating Patna Pirates in final - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Haryana Steelers Win First Ever PKL Title Against Patna Pirates

Date: Dec 30, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Haryana Steelers claimed their first-ever PKL title by defeating the Patna Pirates 32-23 in a thrilling final held in Pune.

  • The Steelers finished first in the league stage of PKL Season 11.
  • Key players included Shivam Patare (9 points), Mohammadreza Shadloui (7 points), and Vinay (6 points).
  • The team earned INR 3 crore as winners, while Patna Pirates received INR 1.8 crore.
  • The final showcased strong performances from both teams, but the Steelers maintained control and managed to secure the win.
  • Mohammadreza Shadloui was named the Most Valuable Player of Season 11.
The Haryana Steelers walked off the mat with the win, which gave them their first-ever PKL title.

In conclusion, the Haryana Steelers have made history by securing their first title, marking a significant achievement in the Pro Kabaddi League.

item.title: "Comes Back To Bite...": Australia Great's Dig At Sam Konstas Over Jasprit Bumrah 'Theatrics' - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Australia Great Critiques Sam Konstas Over Jasprit Bumrah's 'Theatrics'

Publication Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: NDTV

During the 4th Test against India, young Australian opener Sam Konstas displayed notable skills but faced backlash from former player Michael Hussey for his overly theatrical behavior on the field.

  • Sam Konstas had a strong debut, scoring a quick 60 runs.
  • His confrontation with Virat Kohli caught attention at the MCG.
  • Bumrah dismissed Konstas in the second innings, replicating Konstas's earlier celebration.
  • Hussey commented that theatrics often lead to consequences in cricket.
  • Australia reached 228-9 at the end of Day 4, leading by 333 runs in a tense match.
“It always comes back to bite you at some stage. I wonder if Sam Konstas is back in the dressing rooms thinking, 'I wish I charged him'.” - Michael Hussey

This incident highlights the competitive nature of cricket and how actions on the field can have lasting repercussions.

item.title: Ricky Ponting baffled by Pat Cummins as Australia question that ‘hung in the air’ gets answered - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ricky Ponting Baffled by Pat Cummins' Decision in MCG Test Against India

Date: Dec 30, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

In the final day of the fourth Test match at the MCG, questions arose around Australia’s strategy as Ricky Ponting expressed his confusion regarding Pat Cummins' decision-making amidst a delicate chase scenario for India.

  • Australia set India a target of 340 runs after a quick end to their second innings.
  • Jasprit Bumrah achieved a five-wicket haul, becoming the first fast bowler to claim 30 wickets in a single Border-Gavaskar Trophy series.
  • Former captain Ponting expected a declaration from Cummins to maximize Australia’s chances but was surprised by the approach taken.
  • Commentator Tim Lane noted that the decision has resolved a lingering question regarding Australia’s strategy ahead of the final day.
  • The upcoming Test in Sydney poses additional pressure, with weather concerns threatening play conditions.
  • History shows a successful chase of over 300 runs at the MCG is rare, underscoring the challenge ahead for India.
“I thought Australia would have pulled the pin and declared and got as much at India as they could today give themselves the best chance of winning the game.” - Ricky Ponting

As both teams prepare for the upcoming match in Sydney, the uncertainty around conditions adds another layer of complexity to the series.

item.title: IND vs AUS: Jasprit Bumrah breaks Shoaib Akhtar's record - The Times of India
item.description:
IND vs AUS: Jasprit Bumrah breaks Shoaib Akhtar's record

Date: NEW DELHI
Source: Times of India

Jasprit Bumrah has surpassed Shoaib Akhtar's record of 12 five-wicket hauls in Test cricket by achieving his 13th five-wicket haul during the Boxing Day Test against Australia.

  • Bumrah has taken a total of 203 wickets in 44 Test matches.
  • He has now surpassed the records of other legends like Chaminda Vaas and Mitchell Johnson.
  • Currently, Bumrah shares the record with Michael Holding and Saqlain Mushtaq, who also have 13 five-wicket hauls.
  • The ongoing series is tied 1-1, with the final match scheduled in Sydney from January 3.
Bumrah’s best bowling figures in an innings are 6/27, and in a match, they are 9/86.

This milestone marks a significant achievement in Bumrah's career, establishing him among the greatest bowlers in cricket history.
